intro: Hesperidanthus, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its silver-green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Hesperidanthus typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and unique blooming pattern.
